meanings.definition: To clean with water and usually soap or detergent.
meanings.sent1: I wash my hands before eating dinner.
meanings.sent2: She washes her car every Saturday morning.
meanings.sent3: The rain decided to wash away all the dirt from the streets.
meanings.sent4: The waves wash against the shore, creating a soothing sound.
meanings.sent5: After playing in the mud, the kids had to wash their clothes to remove the stains.

meanings.definition: To flow or move in a certain direction.
meanings.sent2: The colors of the sunset wash across the sky.
meanings.sent3: The excitement of the crowd washes over the stadium.
meanings.sent4: Emotions can wash over you unexpectedly like a sudden wave.
meanings.sent5: The memories of childhood wash back to me when I visit my old school.

meanings.definition: A liquid preparation used for cleansing or cosmetic purposes.
meanings.sent1: She bought a new face wash for her skincare routine.
meanings.sent2: The gentle wash left her skin feeling refreshed.
meanings.sent3: The fruity scent of the body wash made her shower more enjoyable.
meanings.sent4: The car wash down the street always does a great job.
meanings.sent5: The laundry detergent is a popular choice for a clean wash every time.
